title: Leo Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(July 23 - August 22)
At last—some momentum returns! From social sync-ups to buzzy brainstorms to exciting business ideas, October is ripe for making connections. And let’s be honest, you’re catching up on lost time, thanks to a challenging summer. 
It wasn’t easy being a Leo, although a little character-building patience isn’t the WORST thing. But still…Venus spent what felt like an endless six-week retrograde in Leo from July 22 until September 3. Then Mercury retrograde jumped in and dragged out the delays until September 15. Argh! If you felt stuck in a constant holding pattern or misunderstood at every turn, fasten your seat belt. Life’s about to move at a much swifter pace.
Even better? You don’t have to do it alone. Until October 23, the Sun is in Libra and your third house of communication, ideas and kindred spirits. Finally you have an eager audience for your novel ideas! Life is so much easier when people are receptive, rather than resistant, to your ideas.
Energizer Mars is also in Libra until October 12, rekindling your fan base and sparking up your creativity. The first couple weeks of the month should be filled with exciting opportunities to share your message and get back on the same page as your crew.
Eclipse season picks up the action even more in the second half of the month. October will feature TWO eclipses—a Libra solar eclipse at the October 14 new moon and the final Taurus lunar (full moon) eclipse in a two-year series on October 28. These game-changing lunar lifts will sweep through your communication and career corners respectively, shaking up the stagnant parts. Out with the old! From unsatisfying friendships to professional plateaus, you are so done with it all. 
Midmonth, connect to as many innovative thinkers as you can. Explore synergies and test your chemistry with a small collab. Then get ready to bid adieu to a chapter of your career or a going-nowhere goal you’ve outgrown. Things are about to get a LOT more interesting, Leo—and way more “on brand” with the person you’ve become.
Caveat: We’re not entirely done with retrogrades, but the planets that remain in this powered-down speed this October are the slow-moving outer planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and (until October 10) Pluto. Luckily these giants don’t really affect our day-to-day lives as much, and their retrogrades can actually be helpful times of integration and reflection.
Two of them, Jupiter and Uranus, are retrograde in Taurus and your career house. You’ll probably be more than ready for any changes that blow in with the October 28 eclipse. Perhaps your Halloween costume should simply be “Leo 2.0”—because by the time the month ends, you’ll feel like a whole new person.
Take a little time to let that sink in. On October 23, Scorpio season begins, and the Sun takes a pre-holiday respite in your domestic fourth house. Catch up on things at Chateau Leo and make all those plans with family. A month from now, the spotlight will be shining directly on you, and you’ll want to have everything in place so you can finish the year with a star turn—the way the stars intend for you, Leo!
Lightness at last? October is one of the liveliest and most social months for you as the Sun makes its annual trip through Libra and your communicative third house until October 23. There’s nothing you love more than swapping stories with a kindred spirit as you share a decadent treat at that buzzy new cafe or window-shop for hours. 
If you’re not talking about everything from your latest bingeable series and “oh my god you have to try it” organic skincare line to that session you just had with a psychic medium, you’ll be devouring books, podcasts and blogs that feed your need for fresh intel. Hello, hungry lion!
And like a true cub, you need to romp and play. That impulse is even stronger this year since energetic Mars is in Libra until October 12, making you restless and shortening your attention span. Let your inner event planner have a field day during Libra season, hosting little parties or rallying the troops for excursions. Hit the fall festivals and gather your friends (and their friends) to check out new hotspots in your ‘hood. Gather recommendations for books, podcasts and restaurants to try. Your curiosity knows no bounds!
Do your best to stay cool on October 8, when an explosive Mars-Pluto square provokes your critical side. With assertive Mars in your communication zone locked into a heated 90-degree square to intense Pluto in your controlling sixth house, you might feel attacked by someone’s harsh words. Your own micromanaging could put someone else on the defensive, making them feel like you’re doubting their judgment. Ask questions before you fling any accusations.
Is the devil in the details? You may find out as soon as October 10, when transformational Pluto ends a five-month retrograde that began on May 1. The retrograde’s first leg was in Aquarius and your relationship sector. But on June 11, Pluto slipped back into Capricorn and your sixth house of health, organization and analytical thinking. 
Power struggles could have erupted, especially with employees or co-workers. If you’ve been dealing with anxiety or a health issue, it may have been hard to discern the cause with shadowy Pluto back-spinning like this. Chronic might have disrupted your sleep patterns or caused you to lapse into self-soothing habits like emotional eating.
Now with Pluto resuming forward motion, you can corral the chaos and get to the root of what ails ya. Take a deep breath: You’ll be better able to manage people—and their dynamics—once Pluto straightens out. 
Have you been afraid to step into your power because you’re worried about pleasing others and being liked? No more! The dwarf planet’s course correction will help you get a better grip on mind-body-spirit balance. A nagging psychological or emotional issue may have been affecting your physical health. The link could soon become clear, putting you back on the path to wellness and vitality.
Share your brilliance, Leo! The October 14 Libra new moon solar eclipse is an especially prime day to spark up a new friendship or have an important conversation. If you’re pitching a creative concept or meeting a would-be client, these moonbeams will give you the gift of gab, so schedule your appointments accordingly.
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will recalibrate your communication sector between March 2023 and March 2025. Get ready for new ways to craft your message, share your ideas and join forces with kindred spirits. 
But first: Do you still have any baggage around doing that? With la luna opposite wounded healer Chiron today, you may need to release some old fears about speaking up and being ostracized for your beliefs. It’s risky to wear your heart on your sleeve (even for a self-expressed Leo). At the end of the day, you want to be loved and praised for your ideas. 
Well, this Libra new moon might be an invitation to care a little less about what other people think and to start taking some risks! You don’t have to put everything out there all at once, either. Share a little taste of your ideas with the public. Take a class or a workshop to build your skills. Test your chemistry with a collaborator on a small project. Start treating life like a grand experiment instead of a performance or a juried competition. You’ll be much freer—and you’ll have a lot more fun! 
Had a little TOO much fun, Leo? Nesting time has arrived. On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio and your foundational fourth house. Home, family and emotional restoration are the themes for the next four weeks. Lean in to those so you can have a full tank for when Sagittarius and holiday season arrive in a month, your most festive time of year! 
What do you need to feel like you’re anchored and secure? This is a worthy exploration. You’re incredibly self-sufficient, but just because you CAN do it all yourself doesn’t mean you should. During Scorpio season, it’s okay to pare down your packed schedule and leave some white space in your calendar. Rest, contemplation and self-care will give your inner voice a chance to get a word in edgewise!
Finding peace and quiet at home could be a little challenging, however. With super-active Mars in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, your household could be a heat zone. There may be visits from family, roommate friction or the extra stress of early holiday preparation. 
Don’t make it more dramatic than it needs to be, Leo. View any flare-ups as a sign. You might need to reconfigure your home’s layout for better space-sharing, especially if you’ve got introverts and extroverts overlapping in common areas. Maybe it’s time for some Fengclass="body-el-link standard-body-el-link"  Shui or space clearing. (Check out our Home Reset course to usher in new energy.) With the eclipses stirring up so much, you might want to start these kinds of projects in November, after the dust settles!
Take a break from all the personal-life stuff on October 28, when the year’s only full moon in Taurus, a partial lunar eclipse, beams into your tenth house of career, leadership and success. You could reach a professional pinnacle where you’re recognized for your talents and hard work. If you’ve been pondering whether to cut ties and move elsewhere, this full moon will light the way.
Today’s full moon is a big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, radically refashioning the balance between career and home. Your personal and professional paths may look nothing like they did a couple years ago.
With expansive Jupiter in Taurus opposing dynamic Mars in Scorpio, you’ll feel this world-life dichotomy acutely today. In fact, you might be even quicker to hit a breaking point if you feel your two “selves” being split. Demands at home could really start to take a toll on your ambitions in ways that push you to the breaking point. 
Reminder, Leo: You CAN and should redesign your life any way you like. But it’s up to you to ask the people around you to pull their weight or to make the necessary changes that support your dreams. You’ve got this—and today’s eclipse is here to drive that message home!
Well…THAT was interesting. For the past four months (since June 5), you’ve been hosting love planet Venus in your sign—an extended trip since Venus typically only hangs out for about a month. Sounds dreamy? Alas, not so much. From July 22 to September 3, Venus was retrograde (backward), disrupting harmony and complicating matters for many Leos in love, friendship and all around ease. 
Venus has been doing her best to make it up to you for the past month since returning to direct (forward) motion in Leo. But it might have been too little, too late. So…let’s try this again next year, Venus? 
On October 8, Venus move on to Virgo. As the love goddess decamps to your stable second house until November 8, she’ll whet your appetite for luxury and stability. Now you’ll settle into a more grounded romantic groove. 
With Venus heating up your earthy second house, you’ll be attracted to reliable people who might have seemed “boring” at another time. For single Leos, sparks could fly with a coworker or someone you meet at an industry event. This realm rules your finances, so couples may need to smooth over any tension around money (luckily, peacemaker Venus is here to help). Whether your “security issues” are fiscal or emotional, talk them through and remember, you’re on the same team here. 
Meanwhile, Mars is charging through Libra until October 12, energizing your third house of communication and kindred spirits. You won’t be at a loss for meeting people now! You could meet someone who sweeps you off your suede booties when you least expect it. Pay attention to friends who insist they know the “perfect” person for you. For once, they might be right! 
Couples will appreciate having a chance to step out of any stressful circular conversations and just enjoy each other’s company. Organize some casual gatherings with mutual friends, like concerts or comedy shows. Variety can’t help but bring some sizzle to your shared life!
Home is where the HEAT is once restless Mars grooves into Scorpio and your domestic sector from October 12 until November 24. No need to wait until the official holiday season to feather your nest or turn your place into a love den. If you’re a Leo who loves to entertain like La Martha herself, Mars will create a lively—and sexy—vibe for any get-togethers you might throw. 
Caution: demanding roomates and relatives could add friction (and not the good kind) to your household with intensifier Mars in Scorpio. Perhaps it’s time to reconfigure your layouts, creating more privacy for yourself. Is WFH life making it hard to unwind into a sensual groove after hours. Follow Virginia Woolf’s directive and find “a room of one’s own”—or a charming cafe—to do work outside your house.
Put your money where your mouth is, Leo, and start spreading the news! With go-getter Mars in Libra and your communicative third house until October 12, your ideas are your currency. You may get a chance to pitch your ideas to a well-connected person at the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. Be ready—the opportunity could arrive in the last minute!
A peak professional moment arrives at the October 28 Taurus lunar (full moon) eclipse, which floods your tenth house of career and success with its manifesting beams. Ready to throw in the towel on an unfulfilling job and try a new path? Poised for a promotion or to pitch a profitable prospective client? This is your moment to go for it. Bring on the deals! 
If you’ve been on the fence about a job or role, it’s a great day to talk to the key players or decision makers and hash out a new, more fulfilling position for yourself. This is the final Taurus eclipse in a two-year series that’s been revolutionizing your career path. Don’t be surprised if an offer comes out of the blue, or a sudden change of the guard happens with your company or clientele. If someone is “eclipsed” away, trust that a much better fit is en route to you, Leo.

title: Cancer Monthly Horoscope
text:
(June 21 - July 22)
It’s the (second) most Cancerian time of the year! With the Sun visiting Libra and your cozy, domestic fourth house—the zodiac zone ruled by Cancer—October puts you in your nurturing, nesting element. Motivator Mars is also in Libra until October 12, energizing your efforts. Whether you’re hosting loved ones, changing up your seasonal decor or getting an early start on holiday prep, your inner “householder” is running at warp speed. (Just please don’t hang up any Christomas lights before Halloween, okay?)
Your ruling planet, the moon, is as busy as you are this month! Two eclipses will activate the skies in the second half of October, moving any stuck energy forward around your living situation, family and friendships. Eclipses are turbocharger transits, pushing us past plateaus whether we’re ready or not. Stay ready for action this month, Cancer, because things could move fast.
Relationships also regain steam after October 10, when alchemical Pluto ends a five-month retrograde and pivots forward in Capricorn, adding potency to your partnership realm. The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde all month long. But with the eclipses sparking up so much action, you might be grateful to have a few parts of your life on temporary hold.
One part that will be far from dormant after October 23: your love life! That day, the Sun sidles into Scorpio for a month, heating up your fifth house of passion, pleasure and play. With spicy Mars here from October 12 until November 24, you’ve got an extended cuffing season. Not that you’ll necessarily want to be “cuffed.” With the Sun and Mars in this frisky zone, you might enjoy basking in the attention of many admirers rather than rushing into an exclusive. If you’re already partnered, enjoy the romantic boost. Halloween costumes could be even more fun to take off than they are to put on. Oh behave! Wait…no, don’t!
All the feelings! The emotion ocean is reaching high tide this October, with a few extra currents pulling you this way and that. For starters, the Sun is in Libra and your sensitive and sentimental fourth house until October 23, which always puts you in a nostalgic state.
As the natural ruler of the zodiac’s fourth house, you’re usually “in the zone” during Libra season as el Sol travels through the foundation of your solar chart and draws out your nurturing and domestic side. Your attention is focused on your family or domicile as the Sun illuminates this most personal part of your life. Ambitious plans and worldly duties can wait. You’ve got root vegetables roasting in the oven and a “vintage botanicals” Pinterest board underway. (Priorities, people!)
This Libra session is extra lit with energizer Mars in Libra on October 12 and a Libra new moon that’s also a solar eclipse on October 14. Change won’t come to your personal life with much subtlety. Get ready for some possible pivots, from a change of address to unexpected visits from relatives to a sudden urge to change up your entire home decor scheme. Easy does it, Crab! You could quickly get in over your head, underestimating the amount of work required to pull off an ambitious domestic or hosting plan.
Watch those volatile emotions this October 8, when combative Mars locks horns in a tense square with vengeful Pluto. Touchy Mars is in Libra and your emotional fourth house until October 12, making you thin-skinned. As the red planet clashes with Pluto in your relationship zone, strong emotions may get the better of you. If you find yourself at wits’ end, pause for self-care instead of forcing a conversation or staging a stormy confrontation. 
Things in a key relationship could blow up—and perhaps this will be a good thing in the long run. Sometimes things just have to come into the open before they can get better. But if there’s any way to have this showdown another day, you’ll have less damage control to do. Unless someone’s behavior or actions need to be addressed immediately, take a timeout to assess the right course of action.
Transforming your relationships is an important item of business starting October 10, when karmic Pluto ends a five-month retrograde in Capricorn and your partnership zone. Have you been embroiled in a power struggle with a key person? Maybe you’ve been hashing out deal points but keep stopping shy of signing on the dotted line for a professional venture. 
Energetically, something’s been holding you back or getting in the way of making things official…but perhaps it’s a blessing in disguise? Now that Pluto returns to forward motion, you can see these dynamics more clearly and work to balance them. With cuffing season underway, it’s a great time to apply your new insights to an existing relationship or with new long-term prospects!
Change arrives at your doorstep—literally—on October 14. The year’s only Libra new moon is a solar eclipse, setting off a fresh six-month cycle for matters of home and heart. Eclipses are harbingers of unpredictable change. These moonbeams will propel you to turn to a fresh page with loved ones. Maybe you’ll suddenly scout for a new address or living situation if you’re in the market for that. (You could find out unexpectedly that you are!) 
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your personal and professional life between March 2023 and March 2025. For the past six months, many Crabs started craving a better distribution of time spent between work and home. Perhaps your career became more demanding, forcing you to delegate some of the household work or vice versa. Maybe you picked up the slack with some family caretaking and needed someone else to hold down the work fort.
If you’re burnt out on your responsibilities, this inaugural Libra eclipse is here to help you add more self-care, art and creativity to your life. Libra, after all, is the sign of balance. The most important thing you can do now is find some of that for yourself. With the eclipse opposing wounded healer Chiron in Aries, you may find that some of your inner journeying informs your next career moves.
Ready to bring a few fall colors back into your life? Some well-deserved fun arrives on October 23, when the Sun moves into fellow water sign Scorpio and your fifth house of pleasure, passion and play. Creativity spikes with your mojo; a fall romance could heat up before the holiday season begins. If you’re in a relationship, get some date nights and fun outings on the calendar, along with a few occasions to pull out your glam gear, even if it’s for a small event you host. (You look adorable in athleisure, Crab, but you clean up nicely too!) Scorpio season ignites your fifth house of creativity, a time to get free-range with an artistic project or put your talents on display.
Lusty Mars will join the Sun in Scorpio, visiting this libidinous lair from October 12 to November 24. Get ready for the passionate energy to dial up another ten notches! Suddenly you’re turning heads and attracting attention with little effort. Enjoy basking in that admiration and let the spotlight reveal your multifaceted talents already. 
You could draw fame quickly with Mars here, but warning: Drama is just as likely to find you. Your emotions are heightened, and the filters are off with combative Mars in this expressive zone. Watch those knee-jerk reactions, which will be even more amplified by the intensity of eclipse season. Channel your diva and dramatic inclinations into a sexy Halloween costume and even sultrier celebration.
If things get a little TOO intense, you can take a huge step back at the October 28 Taurus full moon, which is a partial lunar eclipse. La luna lands in your eleventh house of objective thinking, helping you pull back from the heat zone and cool down. Instead of getting swept up in emotions, you can be the diplomat in the room, helping everyone feel seen and heard.
Today’s full moon is a big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. For the past two years, you’ve been learning to navigate the line between drama and detachment. When is the right time to step into the spotlight and when should you be a team player? The Taurus/Scorpio eclipses gave you equal opportunities to steal the show and be an awesome “backup dancer.”
Have you been way too much of a solo act? The lunar eclipse could bring an exciting opportunity to collaborate, perhaps with someone you meet online or through a cutting-edge community project with a social justice twist. You could connect with a like-minded group of people or discover firsthand how much power there is in numbers. Since full moons can bring endings or transitions, you may part ways with a friend or clique and start hanging out with people who are more on your wavelength. Since eclipses can move at a much more radical pace, you might abruptly part ways with a friendship or a group and move on to another affiliation.
Expansive Jupiter in Taurus will oppose Mars in Scorpio today, underscoring your need to be around people who support your ascent rather than diminish it. Let the jealous haters go elsewhere. You need to be around people who celebrate your full, authentic expression.
Matters of security are on your mind during the first half of the month, as the love planets move through more stabilizing zones of your chart. Mars is in Libra and your fourth house of home, family and emotional security until October 12. Meanwhile, Venus is rounding out an extended four-month trip to Leo and your rooted second house that’s spanned from June 5 to October 8.
While it might sound romantic to host the love planet in this passionate sign for four whole months, there was a plot twist. Venus was in a tricky retrograde cycle from July 22 until September 3, disrupting any hopes of a memorable summer love.
Fear not, Cancer: Your do-over has arrived! The month moves into a flirty and confident phase on October 8 when Venus moves into Virgo and your social, lighthearted third house until November 8. Now, rather than worry about where things are going, you’re feeling independent. If you’re unattached, you may be more interested in cantering around the pasture than in tying up to any one hitching post in particular. You could meet someone through mutual friends or while out on the town.
This frisky energy builds to a crescendo starting October 12, when white-hot Mars zips into Scorpio and your fifth house of fame, passion and romance until November 24. When it comes to love, you tend to favor exclusive relationships, but this could be the moment where you finally discover the joy of casual dating. Dress up as often as you can, if only to make yourself happy (and definitely for Halloween). Baby fever could strike some Crabs now, and if at first you don’t succeed, Mars gives you the momentum (and libido) to try, try again. 
Home, profitable home? With energizer Mars in Libra until October 12 along with the Sun (through October 23), your domestic fourth house is a hot spot. If you work remotely, this is a prime month to get your home office set up for maximum productivity or start a cottage-industry side hustle. 
Even if you report to an offsite location, you’ll still want to bring the crisp edges back to your home, doing a deep clean and purging your file cabinets, for example, or investing in some decor upgrades. Got a room or space you can put on Airbnb or VRBO? Consider supplementing your income with some extra rental cash, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. 
All together now! The Taurus full moon, a powerful lunar eclipse, could bring your shared efforts to a peak moment this October 28. If you have a team project to complete or a tech venture to launch, this eclipse will add momentum. Eclipses bring surprises, and this one could impact the people in your org chart. A colleague or group member could make a sudden departure, perhaps getting recruited to a new job or department. 
Is it time to make your own digital debut? With Mars in Scorpio and your fame-worthy fifth house from October 12 to November 24, this eclipse could put you on center stage with a viral post or a meaningful message.

title: Libra Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(September 23 - October 22)
October’s cosmic marquee has “Libra! Libra! Libra!” written all over it. Not only is the Sun in your sign until October 23, but the spotlight’s a few megawatts brighter (and hotter) while mojo-boosting Mars is also in Libra until October 12. Things are moving at a much more rapid clip than you’re used to, which could be equal parts stressful and exciting. Load up on the immune-boosting supplements, especially if you’re running all over the place. (Being in demand brings perks AND challenges.) 
Midmonth, one of the most powerful moments you’ve had since 2016 arrives. The Libra new moon is a change-making solar eclipse, the first to land in your sign in seven years. Ready or not, a new chapter is beginning—and this time, it’s custom-tailored to the person you’ve become. Allow inauthentic relationships and roles to fall away. Shed that skin and step out as a truer, more self-actualized you.
So yeah, it might sound like a lot, Libra, but consider the alternative: Summer 2023. Suffice to say, you’ve earned a do-over! October is a welcome relief from the uphill battle you’ve waged with the stars since July—and you’re just crawling out of that now.
It all started on July 22, when your ruling planet, Venus, turned retrograde for six weeks, making you feel out of sync socially and emotionally until September 3. Layered on top of it, you endured energy planet Mars in Virgo and your sluggish twelfth house until August 27. Then, adding insult to injury, mental Mercury turned retrograde, shrouding you in mental fog from August 23 until September 15. If you felt invisible, exhausted and adrift at moments, that cosmic lineup certainly played a role.
The slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and Pluto) are all still retrograde this month. But on October 10, Pluto will straighten out, correcting course in Capricorn and your family sector. Challenges in your living situation or with loved ones should get easier, particularly if you’ve had any power struggles.
Eclipses come in pairs, and the October 14 solar eclipse is the first of this month’s duo. The second one, a lunar (full moon) eclipse, will land in Taurus on October 28, touching down in your eighth house of intimacy and investments. It’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled over the Taurus/Scorpio axis for the past two years, revolutionizing your approach to money, self-worth, shared property and the ties that bind.
Seal those changes with a ritual, perhaps on Halloween. That day, the moon will be in Gemini and your expansive ninth house, putting you in optimistic and adventurous spirits. You’ve had enough of those cosmic tricks. Now it’s time to be treated to a wide-angle view of the possible treats that await you, Libra. Let the transformational power of the eclipses carry you over that threshold!
In it to win it! This year’s Libra season charges out of the gate at an especially frisky pace as the Sun soars through your sign until October 23, joined by activator Mars, the planet of energy and drive, which is making its biennial blast through Libra until October 12. This October, your trailblazing initiatives could start a huge buzz. 
The balance your sign is forever seeking may be in short supply as the Sun and Mars keep your schedule action-packed. Roll with it for now, Libra. You’re the spotlight’s favorite target, so shamelessly self-promote! On top of that, a rare Libra solar eclipse arrives at the October 14 new moon, pushing you into prominence and power. Seize this rare opportunity. 
Libra may be the sign of peace, love and harmony, but when you sense injustice, you can see red. Your legendary patience could evaporate on October 8, when aggravator Mars locks into a heated square with manipulative Pluto, ramping up the conflict and tension. 
Mars is in Libra and your first house of self until October 12 while Pluto’s simmering in Capricorn and your home and family sector. Those ties that bind could feel downright suffocating today. Is a close person trying to manipulate you by tugging on your heartstrings? Hold your ground in the face of emotional blackmail and don’t take the codependent bait. You may need to assert yourself in a way that feels unusually forceful. 
It’s not always comfortable to individuate from your family or support circle—Libras as a rule dislike conflict. But the Mars-Pluto square is demanding that you step up and voice your needs powerfully.
Family and home take a turn for the better on October 10, when karmic Pluto ends a five-month retrograde that began on May 1. Until June 11, Pluto was reversing through Aquarius, stirring the pot in your fifth house of romance. Then it slipped into Capricorn and your domestic fourth house for the duration of its backspin. 
Since mid-June, you’ve been navigating intense moods and what felt like a series of emotional earthquakes, especially in your household. Power dynamics with a female relative in particular may have been volatile, with seething resentment or outright anger welling up from the depths. 
Maybe your thoughts turned to your ancestors, with dreams about departed loved ones so vivid that they felt like a visitation. Old family patterns and baggage could have surfaced, making this a productive (if painful) time to process the past and untangle those knots. If you’re a parent, you may have struggled with separation issues between yourself and a child—either feeling smothered by too much closeness or fearful when they pulled away.
That begins to change once Pluto resumes forward motion, helping you pierce the veil of confusion. You’ll be better able to connect the dots and address household conflict at the root, and to let your loved ones be individuated people as you figure out a healthy level of bonding. If the energy in your house feels off, you might experiment with some Feng Shui techniques, starting with a space cleclass="body-el-link standard-body-el-link" aring and deep cleaning. (Check out our Home Reset course for a deep dive.) As you work through emotional issues AND beautify your space, you’ll begin to feel comfortable in your skin again—at home inside yourself.
Rebirth! The October 14 Libra new moon could be a day when fortune and favor smile upon you. Not only is this the sole new moon in your sign this year, but it’s a boldfaced solar eclipse. Think of it as your personal new year or a fresh start times ten. It’s a day to set intentions for the coming six months and then take a bold step forward on your path. 
What personal goal would you like to achieve before 2023 closes out? Connect and commit to that today; these me-first moonbeams have your back! 
This is the first time an eclipse has fallen in Libra since 2016, so it’s an even bigger deal. Ask yourself: What do YOU want? That can be a hard question for your partnership-oriented sign to answer, especially since the moon is opposite healer-feeler Chiron in Aries today. You might feel guilty or torn about wanting something just for yourself. 
But the stars are lined up in full support of that now. It’s okay to prioritize yourself, Libra. You’ll be learning to strike the right balance between “me” and “we” through March 2025, during a two-year eclipse series on the Aries/Libra axis. Give yourself time. There will be moments where your own projects need top billing and other times where cooperation and teamwork are called for most. You can expect to have a hearty dose of both!
Some grounding energy comes in beginning October 23, when the Sun shifts gears into Scorpio and your second house of money, routines and stability. The excitement and excess of Libra season gives way to an industrious groove. Prioritize your projects and devote your time to the ones that will build a sense of security—and a nest egg. 
If birthday binges left you and your wallet with a lingering hangover (well worth the fun!), you can get back to some daily practices and healthy habits that help you feel centered. With go-getter Mars in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, this year’s Scorpio season is filled with motivating energy that can rev up your revenue and position you for prosperity before the year ends.
Who needs Halloween to get spooky…or freaky? This October 28, a lunar eclipse arrives at the Taurus full moon, beaming into your eighth house of mysteries, eroticism and power. This full moon might mark a turning point in a key relationship: Should you stay or should you go? A simmering sexual attraction could reach the point of no return. Longtime couples may venture onto more permanent terrain, such as an engagement, pregnancy or perhaps an official split. Strong emotions can surge up from the depths today, surprising even you.
Today is an especially big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s traveled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. For the past two years, major shifts around money, self-worth, sex and shared investments have been sparked by the eclipses. What’s “mine” and what’s “ours” got some serious sorting out. And you could feel a strong tug to draw that line at the eclipse, especially with expansive Jupiter in Taurus opposing aggro Mars in Taurus. Anyone making too many demands on you could push you over the edge.
As the eclipse blasts into your eighth house of merging, intimacy and joint ventures, you might be offered an opportunity to blend your superpowers in a shared business project, but be sure to conduct due diligence before you go all in. Legal and real estate matters can be resolved, and since the eighth house rules windfalls, you could receive word of a large lump sum (hopefully being paid TO you, not BY you). Look back to the May 19 Taurus new moon for clues of what’s likely to develop now.
Look out for Libra! Lusty Mars is on its biennial tour of your sign until October 12, making you irresistibly magnetic, upping your already serious charisma and drawing attention your way wherever you go—especially locally. On top of that, there’s a solar eclipse in your sign on October 14, putting all eyes on you again.
Make a point of putting yourself out there and letting your sensual side lead. Mars here can offset some of your natural tactfulness, and without meaning to, you could come off a bit opinionated or argumentative. By all means, be direct about your desires. Just give others the same room to express themselves too.
If you’re in a LTR, the first two weeks of October are a great cycle for open, honest communication and being crystal-clear about any needs that aren’t being met. Your side of the bargain: Listen as much as you talk, and don’t get defensive (which Mars can exacerbate). Assume your partner has valid points and, later, take an unblinking look at behaviors you might actually want to shift. Once things are in a nice groove, focus on doing more together as a couple, like taking classes, exploring your neighborhood or taking short romantic day trips.
Meantime, romantic Venus, your ruler, is wrapping up a four-month tour of Leo and your friendship sector that began on June 5. If a connection wavered from platonic to possibly-maybe-romantic all summer, no surprise. Venus was retrograde from July 22 to September 3, making you hesitant at best to explore a connection with more than a toe in the water.
Venus has been in direct (forward) motion for the last month, but that doesn’t necessarily mean you should rush into anything without due diligence. From October 8 to November 8, Venus will visit Virgo and your twelfth house of fantasy and closure. On the one hand, this could be a wildly windswept and romantic time. But it could also be a time of mixed messages and confusions while the love goddess traverses these foggy lands. 
Dial up the sensuality and luxury—and try not to worry to much about “where things are going.” That could be challenging, however, as driven Mars will be in Scorpio and your security-seeking second house from October 12 to November 24. While your appetite for luxury will be off the charts now, you might also bicker over money or feel anxious about locking down a clear commitment from someone. Perhaps you’ll be the one who feels pressure from a “person of interest” who’s pushing for clarification when you’re just trying to explore.
Still, you may not be able to push a decision off until next month. A major moment of truth could arrive at the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse, which floods your eighth house of erotic encounters, intimacy and permanent bonds. The eighth house is pretty black-and-white, and you may be given an ultimatum. Information could surface that pushes you firmly in one direction. It could be as wild as finding out a secret or someone surprising you with a full moon proposal. 
Libras hate making decisions under duress, but sometimes eclipses have to push you off the fence and into action—before you lose a good thing or miss your moment to exit a situation that’s dragged on past its prime.
Put yourself out there, front and center! This is one of the hottest months of 2023 to make your grand debut, loud and proud. Not only is the Sun in Libra until October 23, but mojo-booster Mars is also in your sign through October 12, pushing you into the spotlight. And if that wasn’t enough, there’s a solar eclipse—a supercharged new moon—in Libra on October 14.
Don’t be surprised if you draw attention for your trailblazing ideas—no need to apologize for tooting your own horn. If your ideas are great and can change people’s lives, why wouldn’t you want the world to know about them? 
You can start making money moves on October 12, when Mars makes a fiery trail into Scorpio and your second house of money and earned income. Between now and November 24, you may have a few more expenses, but they’ll also motivate you to raise your rates or seek new revenue sources, which you’ll attract easily under this dynamic transit.
The month ends with the October 28 lunar (full moon) eclipse in Taurus and your eighth house of investments, joint venture and windfalls. Expect the unexpected—hopefully in a large lump sum with a few extra zeros added to the end! You could get a sudden opportunity to buy or sell property, team up with a powerful collaborator of earn a commission. If you’ve been dealing with an ongoing legal matter over the past couple years, things could be finalized and settled at this eclipse.

Money Days: 6, 14
Luck Days: 3, 13

title: Virgo Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(August 23 - September 22)
Sweet stability at last! October will be eventful, but it still holds plenty of opportunities to get settled and centered. Prune your plans and prioritize your options. Focus on one or two key items, especially during the first three weeks while the Sun is in Libra and your sensible second house. Better to do less but do it well!
As a Virgo, you like feeling that you’re making progress toward a goal, even if your process is all over the map. That hasn’t been easy for the past couple months, which were wildly unpredictable for you. First, creative Venus was retrograde for six weeks starting July 22, making your mind foggy and your load too burdensome. Then your ruler, Mercury, joined the retrograde brigade, back-spining for nearly the entire Virgo season, from August 23 to September 15. Talk about a buzzkill! One Virgo friend of ours wisely took the month off to travel through Europe. Well-timed indeed.
Now, after feeling a bit like a helium balloon with the air let out of it, you can get yourself grounded. Or at least, begin the process. Because, as we hinted, October has a few more plot twists in store. Two, to be exact: a solar eclipse on October 14 and a lunar eclipse on October 28.
The first one is in Libra, which could bring new revenue streams and moneymaking opportunities. If you need to ground yourself with regular routines and healthy habits, this October 14 eclipse gives you a giant boost. The October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse touches down in your ninth house of travel, study and personal growth. It’s the grand/finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled over the Taurus/Scorpio axis for the past two years, revolutionizing your approach to communication, learning and social connections. 
While Libra season will keep you busy and productive, your social life picks up speed on October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your interactive third house. With energizer Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, a fun and flirty fall awaits. Step away from your duties and go mingle with kindred spirits and fellow innovators. Exchanging ideas (and contact info) will do more for you now than being chained to your workspace.
RSVP “yes” to that Halloween party, especially if there’s a networking component. With the moon in Gemini and your career corner on October 31, mixing business with pleasure—and costumes!—could put some extra goodies in your basket.
Productivity returns! We’re in the fourth quarter of 2024, meaning it’s time to make a plan. Music to your Virgo ears! With the Sun in Libra and your sensible, sensual second house, the stage is set for you to get ‘er done. Unleash your inner project manager, and you’ll soon feel back on track. 
Normally, you’re on top of your game every fall. But thanks to Mercury’s long retrograde in your sign from August 23 to September 15, motivation and focus went MIA. Don’t worry if you’re making up for lost time. You can accomplish a lot now—AND treat yourself to a few luxe rewards along the way. 
This year, you get a bonus bottom-line boost from energetic Mars, which is making its biennial blaze through Libra until October 12. As the red planet revs up your revenue, a project or plan could heat up fast. Be careful what you wish for, Virgo. You could end up with your hands in many different pots (of gold, but still…) or juggling an accelerated schedule. Be extra discerning about what you take on. Before you say yes, make sure it’s both profitable AND pleasurable for you!
You normally keep a level head, Virgo, but even your even-keeled sign can lose it from time to time. Make an extra effort to hold your fire on October 8 if you can. That day, a volatile square forms between hotheaded Mars in your security-seeking second house and intense Pluto in your dramatic fifth.
One part of you wants to stir the pot just to see if you can get a rise out of someone. Maybe you’re craving attention or feeling insecure and needing to test whether they care about you. But instead of pushing THEIR sensitive buttons, how about just asking point-blank where you stand? Being overly direct may not work, but taking a back-door approach won’t either. (And don’t even THINK about snooping, Virgo.)
Your desire to share your gifts returns with a vengeance on October 10 as transformational Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that began on May 1. For the majority of the retrograde (since June 11), Pluto’s been reverse-commuting through Capricorn and your fifth house of creativity, passion and self-expression. 
Over the summer, you may have dipped below the radar, hiding your radiance while feeling self-conscious. If you were struck with a bout of stage fright or performance anxiety, Pluto’s return to forward motion reminds you that you have something meaningful to offer to the world! Instead of worrying about doing it “perfectly,” focus on the lives you’ll improve with your gifts and talents.
A love affair or relationship may have gone through intense cycles during Pluto’s retrograde. Perhaps an ex surfaced, or you had to work through some old fears and baggage in your current union. That old “come here, now go away” dance gets exhausting! You deserve a break from that confusion, Virgo, and as Pluto corrects course, clarity returns. Should you cut ties or stick around and work through a difficult dynamic? That answer will soon become clear.
Did someone say abundance? Get ready for some money moves as the October 14 Libra new moon—a potent solar eclipse—kicks off a prosperous six-month cycle. This boldfaced eclipse in your second house of financial security could start changing everything from how you make a living to your daily routines. If you’re thinking of initiating a new regimen, like eating cleaner or going to a sunrise boot camp, this lunar lift is a perfect start date. 
This is also the very first Libra eclipse the skies have seen since 2014 to 2016, so you might look back to nearly a decade ago when the eclipses were last in Aries and Libra. That was a powerful time of transformation for your money, investments, intimate partnerships and spirituality, Virgo. And from March 2023 until March 2025, you’re going through another cosmic cycle that will not only rev up your revenue streams but revolutionize them too. 
Got money wounds lingering? This solar eclipse will be opposite healer-feeler Chiron, giving you a chance to dive deep into your past and explore what might still be there. While that won’t necessarily be comfortable, it’s important to clear those blocks out of your path. Just because you don’t acknowledge them doesn’t mean they don’t exist! But fear not: You’ll have a couple years of rich and eye-opening experiences that will remind you how powerful you truly are.
Step away from your work and get out among the people again! On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio, heating up your third house of communication and community. Your brilliant ideas could find a solid fan base and an eager audience. Kindred spirits can pop out of the woodwork, and everything will be more enjoyable when you make it interactive rather than isolating yourself. 
Got an important message to share? With bold Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, you’ll have the planet-powered confidence and courage to speak your truth. Use all the social media and in-person channels you can to connect with like-minded people. RSVP “yes” to events where you can meet more of them. But pace yourself a little bit as you’re unlikely to know your limits and could easily overdo it!
No limits! On October 28, the year’s only Taurus full moon arrives as a partial lunar eclipse, illuminating your expansive and adventurous ninth house. This is an especially big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. 
The way you think, view the world and express yourself have been indelibly impacted by these eclipses. You’ve grown bolder in your expression, more willing to take a chance in business and life. Your adventurous spirit got a chance to flap its wings and fly!
Since the ninth house rules global connections, risk-taking and growth, this lunar eclipse could bring an utterly magical moment in which one of your gambles pays off or a visionary idea springs to life—and spreads like wildfire. Your hunger for knowledge could be sated by a mind-blowing realization that helps you see a situation from a new perspective. Suddenly everything makes sense. 
With worldly Jupiter in Taurus opposing dynamic Mars in your third house of local events today, you might have a real itch to get out of city limits. An opportunity to travel could arise out of the blue. Don’t overthink it. Two words: Wheels up!
At last! Your long-overdue time to shine is about to be here, Virgo. We’re gonna come out and say it: You’ve weathered insult to injury the entire summer and into fall, and your love life was one of the casualties. Not only was your ruling planet Mercury retrograde in your sign from August 23 to September 15, but love planet Venus has been in Leo and your foggy, fumbling twelfth house for FOUR months (since June 5)—with the audacity to go retrograde from July 22 to September 3. 
So…drumroll. On October 8, Venus FINALLY wraps her off-duty summer and enters the realm of Virgo! For one solid month, the love goddess will dance with silk scarves and resume her sultry moves on your behalf. Great ready for an amorous awakening! Freedom is your aphrodisiac this month, so revel in all the admiration that comes your way. And with Venus in your self-empowered first house, you can have a lovingly honest conversation about what you need to feel happy and NOT claustrophobic.
But for the first week of October, you may have to wade through a few lingering insecure and vulnerable moments. And with Mars in Libra and your security-seeking second house until October 12, you could be a bit preoccupied with “where things are going” and ticking off the requisite boxes. 
Try NOT to give into those concerns too much, Virgo, because from October 12 to November 24, Mars will blaze through Scorpio and your social, interactive third house. You’re about to lighten up in a huge way. This will make for a flirtatious and festive lead-up to the holidays.
With bold and fiery Mars in your communication zone until November 24, you’ll be quick with a clever quip and a sassy retort. Warning: Mars adds a bite to your communications. This might come in handy when you have to stand up for yourself, but it could burn some bridges if you keep it up 24/7. 
Friendships will be lively, but you’ll be clear about who you can stand and who works your nerves. One of those platonic peeps could turn into something more under the spell of impulsive, randy Mars. Don’t rush to make it more than it is, though. If it’s a fall fling, let it be just that. There’s no harm in having a little fun—and if anyone’s earned the right to a frisky free ride now, Virgo, it’s you!
October could be one of your most profitable months of 2023 if you play your hand right. The Sun is in Libra and your second house of work and money until October 23 while motivator Mars is revving up your revenue through October 12. There might be a few aggravating expenses thanks to Mars, but there are twice as many chances to multiply your money-making. Don’t overthink it: get moving!
With the October 14 Libra solar eclipse delivering fresh-start energy to your finance sector, a new opportunity or income stream could appear. Eclipses bring surprises and this one might come with dollar signs attached. Your efforts could pay off quickly and build up momentum over the next six months. 
The October 28 lunar eclipse in Taurus could bring an exciting opportunity to launch a business, publish your work or teach your subject matter expertise at a university or continuing education level. A sudden travel invitation could also arrive that’s related to sharing your big ideas with the wider world. Keep your suitcase and jetsetting accouterments ready!

title: Capricorn Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(December 22 - January 19)
The waiting game is coming to an end, Capricorn! This month is filled with gutsy moves and powerful networking opportunities as the Sun travels through the top of your chart, heating up your most public sectors. Not only is the Sun in Libra and your professional tenth house until October 23, but energizer Mars is also making its biennial blaze through this zone until October 12. 
Two days later, on October 14, eclipse season begins with a potent solar (new moon) eclipse in Libra and this same ambitious sector. And on October 28, a second eclipse, this one a lunar (full moon) version, beams into your fifth house of fame and self-expression. Lights, camera, Capricorn! Your solo moment is coming. No need to wait for Halloween to put on a show and turn some heads.
The good news rolls in all month, really. On October 10, powerhouse Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that started on May 1, splitting time between Aquarius and Capricorn. Since June 11, Pluto’s been backsliding through YOUR sign, making it hard for your ideas and personal projects to gain proper traction. That will change as Pluto rockets into direct motion again, rounding out a 16-year, once-in-a-lifetime tour of your sign that ends in 2024. 
All four of the other outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde this month, but you might be grateful for a little slowdown to the action. Saturn and Neptune are reversing through Pisces and your third house of communication and ideas. Take your time before unleashing all of your best material on the interwebs, Cap! Jupiter and Uranus are retrograde in Taurus and your passionate fifth house, tempering that eclipse a teensy bit. So maybe you won’t let it ALL hang out just yet…but start warming up the mic anyhow.
On October 23, the Sun moves into Scorpio and your eleventh house of groups, teams and networking. Unchain yourself from command central and go circulate! This social season lightens your spirits and attracts like-minded people who could become great collaborators. Get to the Halloween parties and set up those lunches before everyone gets too busy with year-end and holiday mania. You’ve got places to go and people to meet!
Get to work, Capricorn! Your marching orders come direct from the cosmos while the Sun makes methodical steps through Libra and your structured, ambitious tenth house until October 23. As the natural ruler of that realm, Capricorns should truly feel “in the zone,” ready to take last month’s lofty ideas and plug them into concrete goals.
This year is even more ambitious because you’ve got energizer Mars burning through Libra until October 12, making you resemble every hard-working, hustling Capricorn stereotype. No shame in that, though! The tenth house is the zone of leadership and public image, and with Mars here, you can rise to a new level of prominence. 
If you’re not plotting your meteoric rise at the moment, it’s still an excellent month to clarify a few “pillars” that you’d like to focus on achieving for the remainder of 2023. Close your eyes and imagine it’s New Year’s Eve: What would you like to say you accomplished and raise a toast to yourself for, Cap? Prioritize THAT and make some bold moves. The October 14 Libra solar eclipse could open a huge portal for your efforts, perhaps one you didn’t even imagine or anticipate!
Some career chaos could erupt on October 8, when hotheaded Mars, which is in Libra and your professional tenth house until October 12, clashes in a stressful square with powerhouse Pluto in Capricorn. Your own vision could be at odds with the group’s, or you may lock into a power struggle with a person in a position of authority. 
Where are YOU feeling trapped by rules, roles and responsibilities? Your soul might be longing for some freedom of expression, yet crushing demands and deadlines are thwarting that. Instead of having a meltdown (if that’s avoidable), use this jarring come-to-the-light moment to STOP doing things that sabotage you personally and professionally. Saying no to what doesn’t work might be the simplest first step. You don’t have to carry the weight of the whole world, Capricorn!
Your call to greatness gets amplified by transformational powerhouse Pluto, which wakes up from a five-month retrograde on October 10, powering forward in YOUR sign. As karmic Pluto shifts into direct motion, you’ll emerge from the shadows and step back into the spotlight. Didn’t see that coming, did they? 
If you’ve been hiding out or dimming your lights, Pluto’s course correction turns up the intensity again. A personal project could speed up, especially if you’ve been blocked by a few obstacles or resistant people who seemed to be undermining your efforts. Have you been considering a style revamp or a major life change? The soul-searching you did over the spring and summer could now pay off, inspiring you to make decisive moves.
Ready for a change to your professional path? Ready or not, one could be en route. The October 14 Libra new moon is the perfect day to start something new professionally or to get going on a major goal. 
Don’t worry, you’ve got the wind at your back in a major way. Today’s new moon is also a boldfaced solar eclipse, the first one in Libra and your career zone since 2016. It’s part of a two-year series that will ripple across the Aries/Libra axis, transforming your personal and professional lives. If you’ve felt polarized between the two, these eclipses, which are occurring between March 2023 and March 2025, can help you become a better-integrated person. 
With today’s new moon sitting opposite healer-feeler Chiron, you may have some deep insights into childhood wounds that you’re still carrying with regards to your work. Perhaps you’ve avoided pain by immersing yourself in a sense of duty, both at home and the office. Maybe you feel locked into an uber-responsible persona, carrying the weight of the world and your loved ones but never letting yourself have any fun! 
Untangling this will be a process, but today’s eclipse will push you into a place where you’ll consider what happiness and professional fulfillment could look like for the person you’ve become. Stay open: It could be wildly different from anything you’ve done so far.
Levity arrives on October 23, when the Sun shifts gears, moving into Scorpio and your eleventh house of groups, teamwork and technology. Step away from your workspace and go mingle. You’ll accomplish more when you focus on “who you know” rather than “what you do.” 
With Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 through November 24, teamwork will be catalyzed. Between now and mid-December, a splashy launch, especially of any digital projects, could grab hold of public attention!
Your passionate side ignites as the October 28 Taurus full moon—a powerful lunar eclipse—blooms in your fifth house of self-expression, romance and fame. This once-a-year lunation brings out your full-bodied, perhaps lesser-seen, side.
Today’s full moon is a big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. You’ve been learning to navigate between head and heart, to figure out when to be the star and when it’s better to be a team player. With expansive Jupiter in Taurus opposite Mars in Scorpio today, you could feel this stretch even more acutely. Should you dive in with your whole heart or hold back a little and play it cool? That’s the equation you’ve been working out.
You’ve had a few spotlight moments during these past couple years, Capricorn, and this one is your encore. What passion, talent or message have you not expressed? Leave it all on the dance floor—this full moon invites you to put it all out there!
Not that you have to go overboard to turn heads now. You could attract attention, possibly without trying, and la luna invites you to unleash the glamorous or showy parts of your personality. Let that inner performer out to play! One of your new fans could have romantic potential. And if you’ve been giving all your lovin’ to an undeserving person, the lunar eclipse reminds you just how many (interested) fish are swimming in the sea. Onward and upward!
Shake it off, Capricorn! On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your intense, intimate eighth house that began back on June 5. While that might sound like something to hold onto, there’s a good chance this cycle had its complications. After all, Venus was retrograde from July 22 until September 3, which could have caused major jealousy, mixed messages and suspiciousness to flare.
On October 8, amorous Venus soars into Virgo and your adventurous ninth house until November 8. Ah, now that’s more like it! Perspective returns and tunnel vision clears up. Venus finds freedom a major turn-on in this part of your chart, so any obsessing will give way to a more balanced view of it all. An attraction to someone of a different culture or background than yours could spark up. For couples, this is a favorable cycle to travel together.
Meantime, energizing Mars is wrapping up a visit to Libra and your career house in the first half of the month, which spans from August 27 to October 12. You could have a LOT going on at work too, which can make it hard to get into that slow and sensual groove. And “leaving it at the office” won’t be that simple. If the object of your affection happens to be connected to your job, well, that’s just more midnight oil to burn. You could meet someone through a work-related event in the first couple weeks of the month.
The lightness from Venus will soon be amplified by her dance partner Mars, however. From October 12 to November 24, Mars will blaze a fiery trail through Scorpio and your eleventh house of friendship and casual connections. Your love life gets stoked by hanging out in groups, whether you meet someone through mutual friends or just bring levity back to your relationship through attending a fun event. Sports games, hayrides, Halloween parties: pick your pumpkin patch poison and take a hearty gulp. A strong dose of Vitamin F (Fun) will be the aphrodisiac you didn’t know you needed quite so badly!
Plain and simple, October could be one of your most successful periods this year. With the Sun and unstoppable Mars both in Libra (the Sun until October 23, Mars through October 12), your tenth house of career and success is ablaze with energy. 
Throw in the October 14 Libra new moon—a scene-stealing solar eclipse—and opportunity won’t just come knocking; it’ll barge down your door. It won’t take “no” for an answer, so sort through your options with care. It’s not a question of whether you’ll get a great offer, but rather, of which one you’ll accept!
The spotlight comes calling at the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse, a day to step out of the shadows and perform your solo act. A creative project, or just your natural talents, could draw attention and even bring fame. Embrace that celebrity status and give your fans the performance they want!

title: Sagittarius Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(November 22 - December 21)
Get out and circulate with your people, Sagittarius! You’re the maestro of every ceremony, at least for the first three weeks of the month while the Sun is in Libra and your social “superconnector” eleventh house. You love playing matchmaker, whether you’re introducing two compatible colleagues or people you think would be a great romantic pairing. 
With energizer Mars also in Libra until October 12, you’re especially motivated to mix, mingle and become a member of an exciting group. Together, you can go farther faster—and with your ambitious plans, Sagittarius, it definitely takes a village to pull them off. 
Things could happen fast this month because October is eclipse season! On October 14 and 28, two change-making eclipses will light up the skies. Expect the unexpected! The first one, a solar (new moon) eclipse, lands in Libra, adding midmonth momentum to your social network. You could be offered a big opportunity to launch a digital venture, speak at a TEDx conference or join a group of thought leaders. Why NOT you, Sagittarius?
If money’s been a source of stress this spring and summer, you may rejoice when alchemical Pluto ends a five-month retrograde on October 10. The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde for the whole month of October, giving you some extra space to step back and weigh your decisions, particularly about work, home and your living situation. Take your time to ponder those while freely exploring some new revenue opportunities.
Power down a little starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your twelfth house of closure, rest and healing. But don’t sink too deep into your down comforter yet. Energizer Mars is in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, which will stoke your imagination and creativity. A bedside journal and morning free-writing sessions could yield some true gems. Be sure to capture them!
On October 28, the lunar (full moon) eclipse in Taurus brings a two-year eclipse series on your health and healing axis to a close. Your body and well-being have demanded your attention since November 2021. There’s no denying that your relationship to both the physical and spiritual planes has been transformed. If you answered the call, this could be a moment to celebrate! 
Take inventory of your habits then and now. Perhaps you went through a medical odyssey, changed your eating habits or completely revamped your routines with supplements or regular exercise. Whatever the case, you’re graduating from this eclipse period—with all of its highs and lows. Here’s to your continued good health!
But first: candy. This Halloween features a moon in your opposite sign of Gemini, which rules your partnership house. Coordinating costumes, anyone? While that’s not typically your style, you might have fun sharing some part of the celebration with a friend or plus-one. Dress up as the left and right hemisphere of the brain or pick your pop culture celebrity duo and do a spooky send-up (zombified Taylor Swift and the ghosts of her dating past?). Most important item on the agenda is that you have some well-deserved fun!
Gather with your people, Archer. The Sun is in Libra and your eleventh house of group activity until October 23, a perfect three-week period to network, entertain and collaborate. Although you’re an independent sign by nature, you need people—and now is the time to put a few key players in place to support your mission. 
With go-getter Mars also in Libra until October 12, you could be cheered and supported by members of your circle. One or two of them could shuttle your ideas onto the fast track, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. 
Mars adds excitement and stress in equal measure, and you may go into “people overload” at moments, having almost too much of a good thing. Teamwork does indeed make the dream work this month, but you need to have some literal dreams (as in, a good night’s sleep!) to keep your energy levels up. There could be a zillion events, conference calls, video chats and parties to rsvp to, so choose selectively. And be sure to log off those social media sites whenever possible, even if your posts keep going viral!
Mars is in “detriment”—a weakened position—in Libra. After all, the planet of war isn’t terribly comfortable in the sign of peace. It’s all too easy to overestimate what you can handle (a Sagittarius issue by nature). Better to underpromise and overdeliver than the reverse. Manage people’s expectations and be sure to delegate! With Mars in this team-centric zone, you could have a power posse of capable collaborators ready to pitch in. Do your part by giving them clear instructions…then letting go and trusting.
Tension over money could spike on October 8, when Mars locks into a heated square with calculating Pluto in your work and money house. 
Go-getter Mars is blazing through Libra and your eleventh house of teamwork until October 12, catalyzing your collaborations. While it could be stressful to manage a few outsized egos and personalities, you can still triumphantly bring these people together for a shared victory. 
Today, however, it could be challenging to get everyone on the same page. Fights around funding or clashing work styles can culminate in a major ego battle. You may have to step in (or pull yourself out) if things get too heated and volatile. Do you have the confidence to pull off a major project? The answer is yes—but you might need to do some internal fortifying before YOU actually believe it. 
Lean on your trusted circle and reliable team members to a point, but remember: They’re not your therapists! Reach out to a coach or trained counselor to do that inner work.
Any controlling or micromanaging tendencies start to clear up on October 10, when calculating Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that began on May 1, splitting its time between two signs. Since June 11, Pluto’s been reversing through Capricorn and your second house of work and money. Whew! 
While the karmic planet reversed through this zone, it may have driven up old fears and limiting beliefs that impacted your bottom line. From power struggles with co-workers to stressful money fluctuations, conditions haven’t always been favorable for you, Sagittarius. Your confidence may have taken a few hits during this cycle. 
Now, as Pluto returns to forward motion, you can regain a sense of power and get back into the financial driver’s seat. If you’ve been unsure about whether to work with someone or take on a project, Pluto’s course correction can help you make a clear decision. 
Get ready for a spike in your popularity and influence, Sagittarius. On October 14, the year’s only Libra new moon—a boldfaced solar eclipse—beams into your eleventh house of groups and teams. Is it time to join a new crew or catapult a collaboration to greater heights? No need to work overtime because the eclipse is pouring rocket fuel in your tank.
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016 and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your stardom and your team efforts between March 2023 and March 2025. You’ll learn how to navigate the spotlight as well as delegate to a capable crew. 
Sharing power is not always easy for your self-directed sign, to be honest. That’s why these eclipses are here to teach you important lessons about leadership. You don’t have to sacrifice your individuality to be part of a group, but that’s how you’ll learn when it’s time to compromise a little instead of bottle-necking progress. 
Today’s lunar mission: Start stocking your squad with people qualified to go the distance with you. This is a powerful time for networking, and, since this futuristic house rules technology, you could launch an online venture or viral piece of content. An opportunity to commune with a cutting-edge group could catapult one of your visionary ideas into the stratosphere. Team up for the win! 
With this new moon opposing wounded healer Chiron today, old pain around feeling invisible, ignored or “less than” could flare up. Your ego may need some repair work—or to head to the timeout chair. If you’re craving recognition or yearning for attention, ask yourself: Why do I want it so badly? Painful as it might be to confront the feelings of abandonment or unworthiness that lie beneath, it’s time to shed those already. What if your desire to share a message was really in service of sharing your light and spreading joy? That’s much more of a win-win, Sagittarius, motivated by creativity instead of a feeling of lack.
Power down starting October 23, when the Sun shifts into Scorpio and your twelfth house of rest and endings. For the next four weeks, the Sun’s low-lit position invites you to slip off the grid as much as possible for self-care and restorative activities. 
Shield your field if you step out into a crowd since you’re susceptible to absorbing everyone’s energy. Carry a grounding crystal, bring a wingperson and have a ready excuse if you need to depart early and get some shuteye! 
With energy planet Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, you’ll definitely need to conserve your resources and get extra rest. You may feel both wired and tired at times. Regulate your nervous system by powering down devices an hour before bedtime, unwinding with a healing sound bath (or bubble bath!) and by nourishing yourself with lots of open calendar space. It may take you longer to bounce back after you exert a lot of energy, so if you work hard, make sure you take twice as much rest as you think you need!
Wellness check! The October 28 Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, illuminating your sixth house of health, fitness and organization. Before you tuck yourself into bed completely, the celestial spotlight beams onto your practices and habits. Are you being as efficient as you could be? Delegating instead of trying to DIY everything? 
The sixth house rules helpful people and employees. This full moon can bring a change of the guard on Team Sagittarius. You could hire, fire or meet someone who’d make a rock star assistant. Is it time for a system overhaul? From a deep decluttering to a purge of apps and subscriptions you don’t use, it’s a powerful day to clear your spaces. 
Today’s full moon is an especially big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, revolutionizing your health and healing sectors. Your approach to work, well-being, spirituality and self-care has been radically revamped over the past two years. 
How are your stress levels? These eclipse helped you find a middle ground between being micromanaging and being checked out. There were moments when your inner control freak got benched, and other times when you needed to snap out of denial and take action. 
Today, this dichotomy is further underscored by your ruler, expansive Jupiter, in Taurus opposing stressful Mars in Scorpio. Rather than bury your head in the sand, it’s a day to finally delegate to the capable and supportive people on Team Sagittarius. An “impossible” situation can be solved with a simple plan—but you don’t have to come up with that alone. Where there’s a will and a willing heart, there’s a way!
Changing of the guard! For the past four months, romantic Venus has been taking an extended trip through Leo and your expansive, free-spirited ninth house—the zodiac zone that Sagittarius rules. Since this is one of your favorite Venus positions, you were probably one of the signs least affected when Venus turned retrograde from July 22 to September 3.
Still, it wasn’t exactly screaming “summer lovin’ had me a blast,” Archer. Hopefully you made up for lost time over the past month, with Venus back on track and swaggering through your ninth house of travel, adventure and personal growth. (We spent a chunk of that time eating and greeting our way through Barcelona—so we hope our fellow Sags made equally good use of the transit!)
Starting October 8, things could take a turn for the serious as Venus moves into Virgo for a month. With the love goddess in your regimented tenth house of long-term goals, you may flip the switch and suddenly want to prioritize some romantic plans before the holidays. Cuffing season could get off to a better-late-than-never start for Archers looking to make things official or strengthen the relationship you’re already in.
Meanwhile, lusty Mars is powering up your social life as it revs through Libra and your collaborative eleventh house until October 12. For your free-spirited fire sign, this cycle might crank up your needs for independence and autonomy; single Archers might feel like your love life is one grand adventure. The boundary between platonic and passionate could be thin, and things could get romantic with a friend, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. One tiny word of caution: You might not have the self-restraint to think through potential consequences—but try to anyway.
On October 12, no-holds-barred Mars moves into your twelfth house of transitions until November 24, decelerating the energy. This temporary slowdown has a silver lining, though: Mars will next move into Sagittarius, cranking up the holiday heat!
Until then, you’re ready to detoxify and downsize. From hauling junk out of the basement to ousting a faux friend from your inner circle, wrap this season with a clean slate. Easy though! With brash Mars egging you on, you could act in haste. (Once you’ve donated the wedding china from your short-lived first marriage to Goodwill, it’s gonna be hard to get back.) If you must say goodbye, do it with compassion—even if you’re done for good. 
Team efforts are the fastest route to success this month, thanks to the Sun, Mars and an October 14 solar eclipse in Libra and your collaborative eleventh house. There’s no question you can go ten times as far when you join up with a supportive squad. 
Don’t be afraid to speak up and ask for what you need. With assertive Mars here until October 12, the key is being direct yet diplomatic. This will take extra finesse when working with a team. Err on the side of politeness at all times, Sag. At the October 14 eclipse, you could be invited to join an elite or avant-garde crew, perhaps one with a humanitarian twist. Membership has its privileges indeed!
But don’t forgot those humble roots—not that you ever would. The October 28 Taurus full moon, a powerful lunar eclipse, illuminates your sixth house of employees and organization. Delegate, systematize and maybe hire some help. Be sure to thank the supportive people who helps you get where you are today. If someone on Team Sagittarius is no longer a fit, this eclipse could be your cue to amicably part ways and wish each other well.
